description:
cmd/hgpatch: support files changed in the root of repository
        So that CL 5706059 can be applied successfully.

messages.text:
LGTM
.hgignore as you decide.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5714057/diff/3002/.hgignore
File .hgignore (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5714057/diff/3002/.hgignore#newcode3
.hgignore:3: *.orig
can we leave this? i don't mind being yelled at about these dregs, because it makes me clean them up. but if there's a tradition to let hg ignore accumulated scurf, then sure.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
http://code.google.com/p/go.codereview/

The main Go repository's .hgignore lists *.orig so I think it's fine here.
I agree that it's nice to clean them up once in a while, but might as
well be consistent.  Please add *.rej too.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=d1782ee9e8b8&repo=codereview ***

cmd/hgpatch: support files changed in the root of repository
        So that CL 5706059 can be applied successfully.

R=golang-dev, r, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5714057

subject: code review 5714057: cmd/hgpatch: support files changed in the root of repository
